summary: Robyn Denholm, the chair of the board of directors, sold nearly $200 million worth of Tesla stock in the past six months . That brings her total proceeds from Tesla stock sales to more than half a billion dollars since taking over as board chair in 2018 .  Denholm recently purchased 112,000 shares at $24.73 each and sold them the same day for more than $270 apiece . Some critics question whether Denholm and other board members are truly independent .  Wall Street Journal reported that Tesla’s board had quietly explored CEO succession options . Board members reached out to several executive search firms to work on a formal process for finding the next CEO . Tesla and Denholm publicly denied the report, with Denholm reaffirming support for Musk .  Denholm and other Tesla directors haven’t received new stock options since mid-2021 . The compensation she’s working through now is essentially the tail end of a long, extraordinarily lucrative run, not a reflection of fresh board rewards .

Tesla has been told to provide information on how its taxis will operate safely in Austin when there is fog, sun glare, rain and other low-visibility conditions that have been tied to accidents involving the company’s driver-assistance software . Those accidents, including one that killed a pedestrian, triggered the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration to launch an investigation in October .  Federal regulators have limited powers over new Tesla taxis that operate without a steering wheel or brake pedals because there are no national regulations on self-driving technology . The agency gave Tesla until June 19 to provide a response .  Regulators posed several questions to Tesla in addition to those about low-visibility conditions . They asked for the number and models of the taxis, when and where they will be deployed in the next few months .  Tesla reported a 71% drop in profits in the first quarter as it faced angry protests over Mr Musk’s embrace of extreme right-wing politicians in Europe and his role in cutting government jobs .

Tesla stock was 5.5% higher as of 2:58 p.m. ET . CEO Elon Musk may be working to tap into a new market on his visit to Saudi Arabia . Sales from China showed Tesla's April sales declined almost 9% year over year .  Tesla's sales in China have dropped by 56%, but stock is soaring this week . That was prompted by the signs of improving trade relations between the U.S. and China over the weekend . Investors are likely buying Tesla stock believing some of that spending could be for the company's AI, energy, and robotics offerings .  Tesla's autonomous driving technology may hold the key to the EV maker being a winning investment . Potential growth in those segments is what has many investors investing in Tesla even as EV sales sink . Tesla has been told to provide information on how its taxis will operate safely in Austin, Texas, when there is fog, sun glare, rain and other low-visibility conditions that have been tied to accidents involving the company's driver-assistance software . Those accidents, including one that killed a pedestrian, triggered an investigation in October of 2.4 million of Musk's vehicles .  The agency gave Tesla until June 19 to provide a response . Federal regulators have limited powers over new Tesla taxis that operate without a steering wheel or brake pedals .  Regulators posed several questions to Tesla in addition to those about low-visibility conditions . They asked for the number and models of the taxis, when and where the taxis will be deployed in the next several months . Musk spoke of an effortless driving future in his investor conference call last month .  Tesla reported a 71% drop in profits in the first quarter . The company could struggle to justify the stock's still-high price . Musk's embrace of extreme right-wing politicians in Europe and his role in cutting government jobs has divided the country .

In April, new vehicle prices came in at no change from the previous month and up 0.3% year over year . Used vehicle prices were down 0.5%, and up 1.5% from a year ago . President Trump's 25% foreign-made auto tariffs began on April 3, affecting European and Asian manufacturers .  Dealers were not shy aboutpromoting tariff-free inventory as a sales tactic in the competitive new car sales landscape . The number of cars on the lot is shrinking, with days of supply falling to just over 60 days .  Several automakers, including Hyundai, guaranteed pricing through the end of May . Further supply and pricing pressures are expected in the weeks ahead . Kelley Blue Book saw prices climb 2.5% month over month in April .  KBB says timing and different data sources may have led to the deviations . With tariffs on foreign-made autos still on the table, prices are expected to rise, meaning April’s lack of change in pricing may be a blip .

Elon Musk's political role in the White House’s Department of Government Efficiency distracted from Tesla's core operations . "Starting early next month, in May, my time allocation to DOGE will drop significantly," Musk said duringTesla's Q1 2025 earnings call .  Net income dropped 71% year over year to $409 million, falling short of the $21.4 billion consensus estimate . The company attributed the drop to reduced delivery volumes, higher operating costs, and increased inventory . No updated financial guidance for 2025 was issued .  Multiple analysts cut their outlooks following the earnings miss . Goldman Sachs lowered its price target from $260 to $235 . RBC Capital Markets dropped its target to $307 from $314 . Cantor Fitzgerald cut its projection to $355 from $425 .  In Europe, Tesla lost its top spot to Volkswagen, according to JATO . In the U.S., 54% of adults view Musk unfavorably, with 85% of Democrats holding negative views . Analysts say Musk's political alignmentis polarizing consumers, hurting the brand's traditional appeal . Mark Fields says positive developments in U.S. trade talks with other countries have helped boost Tesla, Inc. (TSLA) stock higher in recent weeks . The former Ford (F) CEO says the automaker has been boosted by positive progress on the trade front . The automaker reiterated on its first-quarter earnings call that it intends to launch its robotaxi service by June .  In the last month, TSLA has gained 26%, while it has retreated 9% in the last three months . There is an AI stock that went up since the beginning of 2025, while popular AI stocks lost around 25%.

The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has sent a list of questions to Tesla . It's part of an ongoing investigation into Tesla's Full Self-Driving software . The agency wants to understand how the system performs in tough conditions .  Tesla said its robotaxi tests in Austin and the Bay Area had already logged over 1,500 trips and 15,000 miles . The service would compete with Waymo, Amazon's Zoox, and others like Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU), WeRide, and Pony.ai .

Tesla CFO Vaibhav Taneja sold another $1.1 million in shares of common stock last week . The sale represents the second offloading of shares by the Austin, Texas-based electric vehicle maker’s finance chief this month .  Tesla’s stock value has soared in recent months, rising on the news that Musk would step down from his role at the Department of Government Efficiency to focus more on the EV maker . The board reportedly began a search process for a successor to Musk as CEO, according to reports .  Tesla's sales in key regions such as China have continued to wane . April deliveries slumped by nearly 26% compared with the prior month . Company also facing roadblocks related to new projects, such as the launch of its long-awaited “Robotaxis”  Tesla received a letter from the Office of Defects Investigation (ODI) of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) requesting further information about the vehicles’ technology and its plans to evaluate their use on public roads . The office is requesting information regarding the vehicles, including the technology in use and the role of any in-vehicle or remote staff .  Another application to apply “Robotaxi’s” to its ride-hailing service is still pending, TechCrunch reported .

The global economy today is deeply interlinked, making a company's engagement with international markets a critical factor in determining its financial success and growth path . Being present in foreign markets serves as protection against local economic declines and helps benefit from more rapidly expanding economies .  The company's total revenue for the quarter stood at $19.34 billion, declining 9.2% year over year . China generated $4.3 billion in revenues for the company in the last quarter, constituting 22.25% of the total .  Wall Street analysts expect Tesla to report a total revenue of $23.65 billion in the current fiscal quarter . China accounted for $6.05 billion (23.54%), and in the year-ago quarter, it contributed $4.59 billion (21.56%) to the total revenue . For the entire year, the company's total revenue is forecasted to be $98.89 billion, an improvement of 1.2% from the previous year .  International revenue trends could significantly help forecast the company's prospects . Wall Street analysts keep a keen eye on these trends, particularly for firms with overseas operations . Tesla, bearing a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell), is expected to underperform the broader market's movements in the near term . The stock has increased by 26.2% over the past month compared to the 9.1% rise of the Zacks S&P 500 composite . Tesla's Auto-Tires-Trucks sector, which includes Tesla, has increased 20.7% during this time frame .

Tesla's sales in China tumbled to just 3,070 vehicles last week, the worst performance since the start ofQ2 . The brand can sell more cars in seven days there than in major European countries over the course of several months .  China is Tesla’s single biggest market, eclipsing even the United States . More cars can be sold there over seven days than in a major European country like Germany . Tesla's cumulative sales since the start of the second quarterare tracking 25% below the comparable period one year prior .  Production run rates of the new Model Y across all four car factories have already caught up to the older version . This could signal the kind of hiccups Tesla had early last year when its Fremont plant struggled to efficiently change over to the Model 3 Highland .  Even domestic EV brands much smaller than industry leaderBYD, such asNio, Xpeng,Li AutoandXiaomi, could all boast higher sales . This suggests they are suffering less from continued volatility around U.S.-China trade talks .  Domestic brands innovate at “China speed” reducing development cycles on new models to just two to three years from industry standard six to seven . Tesla has never even fully replaced a single car—even the Model S is still the same construction underneath as the version that launched in 2012 . By comparison, Chinese EVs provide 800 volt charging, twice as fast in theory as Tesla’s .  onFortune.com.com: "The world is changing. It's changing. We need to change our perspective on the future of the world."

Cathie Wood and her team at Ark Invest focus heavily on innovation . Her company's approach led to huge successes and notable failures . Investors may assess her approach by the performance of Ark Invest's flagship ETF .  Ark Invest focuses on five key areas of innovation: DNA sequencing, AI, Energy storage, and Robotics . Wood was first invested in Tesla in January 2015 at a split-adjusted price of around $13 .  Ark Invest's initial Tesla investment is up nearly 2,100%, while its first Nvidia shares climbed by approximately 5,200% . The company also owned more than 21 million shares ofTeladoc Health . With that stock down 98% from its high, Ark Invest has since sold all its shares .  Ark Invest had great success with Bitcoin, Nvidia, and Tesla . Unfortunately, the 2022 bear market appeared to catch the company off guard, and the ETF never recovered . Over the last five years, the Ark Innovation ETF's total return isdownby nearly 6%, and that includes an 11% gain over the previous year .  The negative returns of the Ark Innovation ETF show that the search for innovation will often result in negative returns . Investors should still consider buying stocks leading the way in innovation . The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . House Republicans release of tax provisions in massive fiscal bill provides crucial initial reading of what they think could pass . The bill still may change as leaders strike more deals to secure passage in the House . Business lobbyists notched many of the top tax breaks they were seeking, while avoiding levy increases .  The draft would permanently set the top tax rate for individuals at 37%, extending the rate set by President Donald Trump’s 2017 tax bill . Without new legislation, the top rate is set to expire and would revert back to 39.6%. The limit on state and local tax deductions would rise to $30,000 – a slight increase from the existing SALT cap .  The bill also would place a new income test on eligibility for the tax deduction, phasing it out for individuals earning more than $200,000 . Tips, Overtime and Autos would be exempt from income tax through 2028, fulfilling a Trump campaign promise .  The bill does not make any changes to the tax treatment of carried interest after a massive lobbying campaign by affected industries . The maximum amount any company can get in such tax write-offs is calculated as a percentage of earnings .  Under Trump’s 2017 tax law, some colleges with the most well-funded endowments pay a 1.4% tax on their net investment income . The levy would rise to as high as 21% on institutions with the largest endowment . The provision is a major escalation in Trump's fight with Harvard and other elite colleges and universities .  A popular consumer tax credit of up to $7,500 for the purchase of an electric vehicle would be fully eliminated by the end of 2026 . The bill would limit write-offs for professional sports teams that claim deductions connected to the team’s intangible assets, including copyright, patents or designs .  Elderly Americans aged 65 and older would get a $4,000 bonus added to their standard deduction through 2028 . Immigrant communities would face a new 5% tax on remittances sent to foreign nations . A tax credit for the production of nuclear energy would also be phased out by 2031 .  The bill does not include Trump’s call for a lower corporate tax rate for domestic producers . Instead allows 100% depreciation for any new “qualified production property” like a factory . The bill would create new tax-exempt investment accounts to benefit children .  The bill would authorize one-time $1,000 government payments into accounts for children born from 2025 through 2028 . Adult children would be able to use the funds for purchasing homes or starting small businesses . Owners of pass-through businesses would be allowed to exclude 23% of their business income when calculating their taxes .  US Border Towns are being Ravaged by Canada’s Furious Boycott . Tesla's historical growth trajectory was unbelievable, but the automaker is now struggling . Prospective investors today must consider how bullish they are about Musk's robotaxi vision . Despite how volatile it has been along the way, it's impossible to denyTesla's long-term share price performance .  During the first three months of 2025, its vehicle sales declined 20% year over year to $14 billion . Tesla essentially launched the EV market as we know it today . The company's operating income tanked by 66% in Q1 .  Investors should not expect Tesla in the future to deliver the type of growth it did in the past . Analysts' consensus estimates are that its revenue will increase at a compound annual rate of 13.4% between 2024 and 2027 . Only investors who are extremely bullish on Musk's vision for what Tesla could become one day should buy the stock right now .  Tesla will launch its robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, next month . Elon Musk intends to bring the service to more U.S. cities by the end of the year . How Tesla will fare in its attempt to launch aworldwide roboticaxi fleet is impossible to predict .  Tesla's high valuation means it's best to avoid investing in Tesla . Tesla is trying to make a positive impact on society, but there is a lot of uncertainty about how it might fare from here .  There may not be another chance like this anytime soon . You can buy Tesla stock with $1,000 and hold it for 20 years . The Motley Fool offers you the chance to invest in Tesla and other high-flying companies .

Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF MAGS has lost 6.4% so far this year (as of May 12, 2025) The group of tech giants known as the "Magnificent Seven" has been battered by the tariff turmoil . The latest U.S.-China temporary trade truce came as a surprising relief to the space .  The United States agreed to temporarily lower tariffs on Chinese imports . The reductions will last 90 days, following two days of high-stakes talks between the two nations . Along with Apple, Tesla is heavily dependent on Chinese parts and battery suppliers .  Chinese clients make up between 20% and 40% of NVIDIA’s end customer base, according to DA Davidson analyst Gil Luria . 90% of iPhones are manufactured in China, representing 17% of 2024 revenues . Meta: Chinese advertisers contributed roughly 11% of total ad spending, Raymon James noted .  Meta-heavy ETFs like Fidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETFFCOM can be played for specific stock preference . Consumer Discretionary Select Sector SPDR FundXLY invests about 35% of its basket in Amazon and Tesla .  SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) (XLY) (XLG) iShares Global Tech ETF (IXN) (IGN) iSXLY (IGT) (AGT) and (IGTC) (GOOGL) are all listed in the XLY index .

Rivian Automotive delivered surprisingly strong Q1 2025 results last week . The company reported a significant revenue boost while its loss per share narrowed to $0.41 . With $8.5 billion in cash and short-term investments, Rivian appears well-positioned to weather near-term market instability .  Rivian reported a $22,600 year-over-year cost reduction per vehicle in Q1 2025, a significant improvement in manufacturing and supply chain efficiencies . Revenue from software and services surged 258% to $318 million . Strategic partnerships are also important in Rivian’s growth .  Despite solid Q1 results, management lowered its 2025 target to 40,000-46,000 vehicles . The reduction was driven primarily by the anticipated impacts of new tariffs . The company still faces supply chain vulnerabilities (especially for battery materials and semiconductors), substantial cash burn (with negative free cash flow exceeding $5 billion over the past year)  Rivian has raised its capital expenditure forecast to $1.8-1.9 billion . The company delivered about 8,640 vehicles in Q1 and aims for 40,000-46,000 in 2025 . Rivian currently holds approximately 2.9% of the U.S. electric vehicle market .  Rivian trades at approximately 2.5x sales, a relative premium for a company that’s not yet profitable . The EV market is projected to reach 26% of U.S. new vehicle sales by 2030 . The broad consensus of the 25 analysts covering the stock on Wall Street is neutral .  Canaccord Genuitymaintains a Buy rating with a $23 price target, citing Rivian’s potential to establish itself as a leading EV platform in Western markets .Wedbush reiterated its Outperform rating while lowering its price target from $20 to $18 .  Near-term catalysts include continued cost improvements, the official closing of the Volkswagen partnership, and updates on R2 development . However, meaningful stock appreciation may require patience until after the R2 launch in 2026 .

Electric vehicle maker is offering financing deals as low as 0% on the spanking new version of the Model Y . Early signs of weak demand for the restyled Model Y- launched in January - come amid stiff competition .  Global sales data on the refreshed Model Y is not yet available, leading analysts to pursue clues on how Tesla is marketing the vehicle . The refreshed version is available immediately in many parts of the world, with some units already available .  After Tesla reported its first drop in annual deliveries last year, Musk pulled back his forecast of a 30% increase in vehicle sales this year . Last month, Tesla said it would revisit that forecast in three months in light of "shifting global trade policy" After a 13% drop in first-quarter vehicle sales, analysts expect Tesla deliveries to fall again .  Model Y's most striking feature is a light bar that stretches across the front of the car, much like the Cybertruck, which too has failed to find many buyers . The new Model Y is selling at roughly the same price as the previous version, although Tesla regularly raises and lowers prices . Tesla did not respond to an email seeking comment .  Tesla is promoting a five-year 0% interest rate on the Model Y before June 30 . The average U.S. interest rate for new vehicles in April was 7.1%, according to Edmunds . A 1.99% rate would save a customer anywhere from $4,500 to over $6,600 .  "something from a pricing story to talk about," Caldwell said . Caldwell said. "We have a lot of things to do with" in the U.S.

The Big Tech trade was alive — and well, even before the announcement of a temporary deal with China . Negotiations between the US and China yieldeda 90-day pause, removing sharpest fangs from tariffs the rival nations set on each other . The stock market celebrated the lower chances of a global recession and Chinese-American splintering .  Wedbush analyst Dan Ives says new highs for tech stocks are now on the table in 2025 . The risks of a prolonged conflict with Chinato Magnificent Seven members have been weighing on investors .  As a group, the Mag Seven stocks are still way off their highs from earlier this year . Still, investors have benefited relative to the broader market by holding these names . Most of the names have posted significant gains since the 90-day global tariff pause . Tesla shares trade at an expensive valuation, but the company's earnings growth may accelerate . Apple stock is expensive, and the company is battling headwinds related to tariffs, antitrust legislation, and its failure to monetize AI in a meaningful way . Most Wall Street analysts see downside in Tesla stock and upside in Apple stock in the next 12 months .  Wall Street analysts see Apple as the best buy, at least over the next 12 months . But investors should focus on longer time horizons . The investment thesis for Tesla centers on large opportunities in electric vehicles (EV), autonomous driving, and humanoid robots .  Tesla is leaning on its artificial intelligence (AI) expertise to develop an autonomous humanoid robot called Optimus . The company expects thousands of robots to be working in its factories this year . Wall Street expects Tesla's adjusted earnings to grow at 15% annually through 2026 .  The investment thesis for Apple centers on its strength in smartphones . The average iPhone sold for more than twice as much as the averageSamsungsmartphone in the first quarter . Apple also monetizes its installed base with adjacent services like iCloud storage, App Store advertising and fees .  Wall Street anticipates Apple's earnings will increase at 6% annually through 2026 . Apple is battling two headwinds that may drag on earnings growth . The company has shifted some iPhone production to India, but most high-end models are still made in China .  On rare occasions, our expert team of analysts issues a“Double Down” stockrecommendation for companies that they think are about to pop . Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late . Nvidia:if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $302,503!* Apple: If you invested  in Apple in 2008, you'd have $37,640!* Netflix:  Apple stock is the best buy in the world, according to Wall Street analysts . Tesla and Apple are both valued at $1.5 billion each .

Three high-flying stocks with easily-identifiable headwinds and serious valuation concerns are more trouble than they're worth . Wall Street's major stock indexes have all entered correction territory in 2025 . Over the long run, being an optimist pays off handsomely on Wall Street .  AI-driven data-mining specialistPalantir Technologies has a lot working in its favor . Palantir's government-focused Gotham software-as-a-service platform has no one-for-one replacement . However, shifting to recurring profits ahead of Wall Street's consensus, possessing a sustainable moat, and growing sales by roughly 30% annually .  Palantir entered the previous week at a P/S ratio of more than 100 . At no point throughout history has a megacap company been able to sustain a price-to-sales ratio of 30, let alone a value three times this amount .  AI solutions, artificial intelligence appears to be the next in a long line of early innings bubbles . Palantir's predictable operating cash flow, vis-à-vis its multiyear contracts and subscriptions, it wouldn't experience a sudden revenue drop-off if the AI bubble bursts . Tesla's best attribute has been its five consecutive years of GAAP profit .  The issues I have with Tesla can be boiled down to four core factors . Tesla's first-mover EV advantages are fading. It's also attempting to spread its wings beyond the cyclically driven auto industry . The end result has been a rapid decline in the company's vehicle margin .  Tesla's 2025 GAAP earnings are on track to decline by 56% from 2023, and aren't expected to reach 2023's EPS level again until 2028 . CEO Musk often fails to deliver on game-changing projects such as Level 5 full self-driving .  Strategy was a middling enterprise analytics software provider for decades . Over the last decade, its software sales have slid by nearly 13% . CEO Michael Saylor completely pivoted his company's strategy to acquiring Bitcoin . As of May 5, Strategy held 555,450 Bitcoins, which it's spent more than $38 billion to acquire .  Strategy will be issuing even more of its shares to satisfy the high yields of its preferred stock . Strategy's software segment isn't generating positive operating cash flow, which means issuing shares is the company's only alternative to raise capital . Strategy requires that Bitcoin only move up, and history shows a number of steep bear markets for the world's largest digital currency .  Strategy. about $57.25 billion . However, its market cap at the closing bell on May 9 was $113.74 billion . Applying averygenerous $1 billion valuation to the company's shrinking software business means investors are paying a 97% premium to NAV to own shares of Strategy. In short, they're paying about $204,200 per Bitcoin .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is 907% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to163% for the S&P 500 . The S&P 500 rose +3% in today’s trading session, with the Nasdaq spiking over +4%, as investors flock to big tech stocks that had sold off during rising trade tensions . Apple AAPL, Amazon AMZN, Meta Platforms META, and Tesla TSLA led the market gains on Monday .  Tesla lands a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) based on a trend of declining earnings estimate revisions . Suggesting now may be a good time to fade the rally in Tesla stock is that TSLA has spiked +25% in the last month . Microsoft is the only Mag 7 stock that currently has a buy rating .  Alibaba BABA and Tencent TCEHYare two Chinese tech stocks to pay attention to and currently sport a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) Their ADR’s (American Depository Receipts) have been two of the top performers on U.S. stock exchanges this year, with BABA soaring nearly +60% year to date .  China accounted for 14% of Nike’s revenue in 2024, with $5.5 billion coming from footwear sales alone . Nike and Walmart stock stand out with a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), while Starbucks and Target stock have a Rank #4 (Sell) Plus, China accounts for a significant portion of their revenue from their operations within China, which would make better trade relations between the U.S. and China beneficial to their outlook .  The U.S. and China trade agreement gave the market what it was looking for . Investors now have more reassurance that the global economy will be less impacted by higher tariffs . That said, keeping an eye on the progress that is hopefully made in the next 90 days will be critical .  Tencent Holding Ltd. (TCEHY) and Starbucks Corporation (SBUX) are among the leading companies in China . WMT (WMT) is one of the top three companies in the world, according to Zacksacks .

Shares of Tesla rose nearly 7% to close at $318.38 Monday, bringing the company's market cap to $1.02 trillion . That makes the automaker one of just nine American companies worth $1 trillion or more . The EV maker has faced apolitical backlash over CEO Elon Musk's involvement in the Trump administration .  Last month marked Tesla's seventh straight month of year-over-year declines in shipments from China . Sales have lagged, includingin China, where the company shipped fewer vehicles in April than it did a year earlier .
